articles.title: 7th Congress of KCU Held
articles.content:
7th Congress of KCU Held
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The 7th Congress of the Korean Children's Union was held with splendor at the April 25 House of Culture on Thursday.
					 The congress is of great significance in strengthening the KCU developed under the care of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il into the Songun children's revolutionary organization of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung formed the Saenal Children's Union, the first children's revolutionary organization in Korea, provided the origin of the Juche-oriented children's movement and closely rallied children around the flag of the anti-Japanese children's corps in order to bring them up to be the iron-willed young revolutionaries.
					
					 Kim Il Sung founded the KCU after the liberation of Korea. He brightly indicated the way for the Korean children's movement to advance in each period and at each stage of the revolution and energetically led the KCU members to give steady continuity to the revolutionary cause of Juche started on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 In the last period of his life, he sent a congratulatory message to the participants in the 5th Congress of the KCU and had a picture taken with them.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, taking the work of bringing up the successors to the revolution as the most important work of the party and the state, wisely led the work with main emphasis on firmly preparing the KCU members to be the genuine child vanguard of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Un made sure that the event of celebrating the 66th anniversary of the KCU was held with splendor last year and had pictures taken with children. He also took part in the joint national meeting of the KCU organizations and made a congratulatory speech.
					
					 He also provided field guidance to Pyongyang Myohyangsan Children's Camp and the Songdowon International Children's Camp, giving earnest teachings to provide new generation with happy life the whole world will be envious of.
					
					 Present at the congress were delegates selected from KCU organizations across the country, officials in charge of children's life and other officials concerned.
					
					 Also present at the congress as observers were children of servicepersons on Jangjae, Mu and Wolnae islets and other frontline posts and schoolchildren in Pyongyang.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un, the benevolent father of the Korean schoolchildren, appeared on the tribune of honor of the congress hall.
					
					 A member of the KCU put a red tie around his neck. 
					
					 He congratulated the delegates on their enthusiastic cheers and warmly acknowledged all the participants in the congress.
					
					 Taking the tribune of honor were KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials of the youth league and officials concerned and KCU members who set an example in study and organizational life.
					
					 A clarion sounded the start of the congress and the flag of the KCU was hoisted.
					
					 Two agenda items were put up for discussion: 1. On the tasks of the KCU to bring up its members to be young revolutionaries and vanguard of Songun era always following the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in firm conviction; 2. On revision of the rules of the KCU.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made a report on the first agenda.
					
					 He said the glorious course of the KCU has been associated with the deep loving care of the Generalissimos who provided deep and firm roots for the Juche-oriented children's movement and led the KCU step by step in line with the requirements of the developing revolution.
					
					 He referred to the great successes of the KCU after the 6th congress under the sagacious leadership and meticulous care of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called upon the KCU members to cherish honor and pride of being members of glorious Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's KCU and firmly prepare themselves to be reliable successors of the Songun revolution faithful to Kim Jong Un, true to their pledges before the KCU flags.
					
					 Speeches followed the report.
					
					 The speakers talked about their honor of taking part in the congress in the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un and their pride of acquiring ample knowledge, good moral character and good health under the deep care of the peerlessly great persons. They also vowed to carry forward the traditions of Mt. Paektu under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Un heard with keen interest the speeches of delegates, warmly applauding them.
					
					 A decision on the first agenda was adopted.
					
					 They discussed and decided upon the second agenda.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Delegates to 7th KCU Congress
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Delegates to 7th KCU Congress
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Thursday had a photo session with the delegates to the 7th Congress of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 Present there together with him were KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 Chairman Jon Yong Nam and vice-chairmen of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League were also present.
					
					 KCU members presented bouquets to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said the congress marked an important occasion in eternally glorifying the undying feats of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who dedicated their all to developing the Juche-oriented movement of the Korean children. He warmly congratulated the participants in the congress who demonstrated before the world through the congress the spirit of the KCU members firmly preparing themselves to be dependable builders of the thriving nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed expectation and belief that the delegates to the 7th Congress of the KCU would always take the lead in consolidating the KCU organizations to be stronger ranks of the pillars responsible for the future of the great Paektusan nation.

articles.title: KCU Members across Country Celebrate Founding Anniversary
articles.content:
KCU Anniversary Celebrated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The members of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) significantly celebrated its 67th anniversary.
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un called June 6 the holiday of the KCU members precious to the Workers' Party of Korea and all the people. He made sure that the anniversary of the KCU is celebrated as national holiday every year.
					
					 KCU members in Pyongyang and different parts of the country laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and portraits of smiling Generalissimos and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Ceremonies for children's admission to the KCU took place at joint meetings of the KCU organizations and KCU general meetings at schools in provinces, cities and counties. 
					
					 On the same day, sports and amusement games, public presentation of art works and talents were held at junior and senior secondary schools, primary schools, branch schools and other schools and camps across the country. They showed the world of the children's mind, giving pleasure to teachers and parents.
					
					 The games included 100 meter and 400 meter running, group running, hurdle races, throwing balls into ring, Korean wrestling, shuttlecock games and football matches.
					
					 Children of North Hwanghae Provincial Secondary School, Haeju Secondary School, Jaeryong School and Kilju Primary School played sports and amusement games, enjoying the holiday.
					
					 Campers at Jangjasan Children's Camp, Sohungho Children's Camp and other children's camps in different parts of the country gave art performances, held sports games and dancing parties, cruised aboard sightseeing ships and went boating in celebration of the anniversary.

articles.title: CPRK Special Statement Proposes Talks between Authorities of North, South
articles.content:
CPRK Special Statement Proposes Talks between Authorities of North, South 
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) released the following special statement Thursday:
					 It is 13 years since the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 All the Koreans still remember the June 15 era when the spirit for national reunification ran high all over the country and are ardently wishing for the earlier improvement of the north-south relations and opening of a new phase for reunification.
					
					 The publication of the joint declaration was a special event for the Korean nation in making steps toward ending the history of division and confrontation forced by outsiders and opening up a new era for independent reunification.
					
					 Signal events that were presented on this land after the advent of the June 15 era proved that there is nothing impossible for the Koreans to do and that they can achieve the common prosperity of the nation and reunify the country for sure if they pool their efforts.
					
					 But the advance of the June 15 era has been held back and the last legacy of the era has been placed at the peril of destruction due to the serious challenge by anti-reunification forces at home and abroad. This is truly deplorable.
					
					 South Korean businessmen are now strongly calling for the normalization of the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) and the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang. Families and their relatives separated in the north and the south are also craving reunion with their kinsfolk in their lifetime.
					
					 Whoever Koreans can never shun this tragic situation of today.
					
					 We have so far made every possible effort to improve the north-south ties now at a deadlock, resume tour of Mt. Kumgang, normalize the operation in the KIZ and settle humanitarian issues.
					
					 But all the sincerity and magnanimity shown by the DPRK have been denied and defiled with such sophism as "sincerity", "contradiction among southerners" and "evasion of talks between authorities".
					
					 We have never sought to create "contradiction among southerners". 
					
					 We have neither treated the south side's authorities lightly nor approached it the way of making a fun of it as claimed by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 It is none other than the south Korean authorities who are abusing north-south dialogue for the purpose of escalating confrontation in a bid to meet their strategic aims
					
					 However, we have no idea of idling away time with useless word-playing and exchange of rhetoric.
					
					 If the north and the south insist on their own assertions, it will never be possible to find a way of solving pending issues between the two sides. This will further increase despair of south Korean businessmen and other people and disappointment of all fellow countrymen.
					
					 In view of the prevailing situation, the desire of all fellow countrymen and the ardent request of south Korean businessmen and other people, the CPRK clarifies the following crucial stand upon the authorization:
					
					1. We propose holding talks between authorities of the north and the south for the normalization of the operation in the KIZ and the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang on the occasion of the anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 Such humanitarian issues as the reunion of separated families and their relatives can be discussed at the talks, if necessary.
					
					 The venue of the talks and the date for their opening can be set to the convenience of the south side.
					
					2. We propose promptly realizing visits to the KIZ and the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang by south Korean businessmen and working contacts and promoting visits, contacts and cooperation among NGOs of the north and the south.
					
					     We have already approved the visits to the KIZ by businessmen and will allow the visits to the areas of the north side by south Korean businessmen concerned with the tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					     We also flung open the door to visits, contacts and cooperation among NGOs of south Korea.
					
					3. We propose realizing joint national events to mark the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration and jointly commemorating the 41st anniversary of the July 4 joint statement in the presence of the authorities of both sides.
					
					 The commemoration of the June 15 joint declaration and the July 4 joint statement in the presence of the authorities together with NGOs of both sides will be significant and contribute to improving the north-south ties.
					
					4. As soon as the south Korean authorities respond to our proposal with a view to ensuring talks between the authorities of the north and the south, visits to the KIZ and Mt. Kumgang by south Korean businessmen and joint national events and smoothly settling pending issues between the north and the south, all the relevant measures concerning communications and liaison will be taken including the issue of reopening the Panmunjom Red Cross liaison channel.
					
					 Consistent is our stand to promote national reconciliation and unity and achieve reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly stand for building confidence and improving the north-south relations, they should not miss this opportunity but positively respond to our bold decision and sincere proposal, away from misguided speculation and suspicion.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction of Mirim Riding Club
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction of Mirim Riding Club
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Mirim Riding Club the construction of which is now under way by the People's Army.
					 The premier encouraged soldier-builders to give full play to the militant spirit of the revolutionary army in building the club, true to the order of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Being briefed on the general layout of the club and the map showing the bird's-eye view of the project, he learned in detail about its construction and supply of raw materials.
					
					 The consultative meeting held on the spot underlined the need to rapidly finish frame structure to suit seasonable conditions. It took measures to supply necessary materials and fuel as scheduled and increase production to the maximum at material producing units.
					
					 Prior to it, the premier went round the Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City in its efforts to glorify the honor of a model farm in the era of Songun.
					
					 Going round different places, he learned about the farming there and convened a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed issues of conducting agricultural production and business activities on the principle of arousing enthusiasm of farmers to the maximum.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Railways of the DPRK headed by Minister Jon Kil Su left here on Thursday to attend the 41st Ministerial Meeting of the Organization of Railways Cooperation due in Estonia. 
					 Leaving here on the same day was a delegation of the Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK headed by Councilor and Department Director Ri Song Chol to visit African countries.

articles.title: Reception Given on National Day of Sweden
articles.content:
Reception Given on National Day of Sweden
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Karl-Olof Andersson, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy on Thursday to mark the national day of Sweden.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Sweden Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					 A staff member of the Swedish embassy attended.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Prior to the reception, there took place a fine art exhibition of Sweden in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Sweden.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Congratulates 7th Congress of KCU
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Congratulates 7th Congress of KCU 
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- All the members of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) should grow up to be sons and daughters loyal to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un and leading force of thriving Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun editorially says this on Thursday.
					
					 The 7th Congress of the KCU is to take place in Pyongyang today, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 The congress is a culmination of the deep loving care for posterity of the Workers' Party of Korea getting warmer as the days go by.
					
					 It is also an event of political significance that will powerfully demonstrate the admirable features and courageous spirit of the KCU members growing up with no more to desire in the world with the blessing of illustrious leaders and the sun generation after generation.
					
					 All people in the DPRK send warm congratulations to the historic 7th Congress of the KCU and wish the children bright future, hoping they will bloom under the warm care of the sun.
					
					 The KCU has nearly 70 years of history under the wise leadership of the great leaders and party and in this course it has set a fine example of the era in settling the juvenile issue.
					
					 In the arduous course of the revolution it has fully displayed the spirit of young Korean revolutionaries, righteous, sturdy and brave.
					
					 Now in the DPRK the KCU flags are flying around the flags bearing the immortal beaming images of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The KCU flags are fluttering together with the flags of the Workers' Party of Korea, colors of the Korean People's Army and the flag of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					 The participants in the congress, all the KCU members and the people across the country are hardening their will to glorify the leadership exploits the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu performed for the juvenile movement in Korea as the eternal treasure of the nation.
					
					 The 7th congress will help consolidate the revolutionary nature of the KCU as a juvenile organization of the leader and strikingly demonstrate the infinite loyalty of the KCU members, who are determined to uphold the Generalissimos in high esteem just like sunflowers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Provocative Remarks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Provocative Remarks
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- U.S. Secretary of Defense Hagel and Minister of Defense of south Korea Kim Kwan Jin blustered at their recent talks in Singapore that "they will never allow the provocation and threat from the north" and "it entails an isolation", seriously getting on the nerves of the DPRK and slandering it. 
					 They also called for "strengthening combined defense capabilities" enough to overwhelm the DPRK and discussed the issue of establishing the combined field command to replace the south Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command after the "transfer of wartime operation control".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is the provocative remarks that chill the sincere efforts made by the DPRK to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula and provide an atmosphere of dialogue.
					
					 Matter is that the top military officials of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime again took issue with the DPRK and kicked off the action of confrontation at a time when the atmosphere of dialogue regarding the situation on the peninsula is being created with so much effort.
					
					 What can never be overlooked is that the U.S. and the south Korean regime disclosed their intention to set up a combined field command equivalent to the present combined forces command while calling for "strengthening combined defense capabilities" under the pretext of the "transfer of wartime operation control".
					
					 This is a serious military provocation against the DPRK, a result of the common interests sought by the U.S. which seeks to realize the strategy for invading the DPRK while maintaining the system of military domination over south Korea and by the south Korean warmongers who plan to realize their ambition to invade the north at any cost by tightening the military collusion with their master, the U.S. after the "transfer of wartime operation control". 
					
					 The talks between warmongers held in Singapore are aimed to persistently strain the situation. They are a vicious challenge to the public opinion for the relaxation of the tension on the peninsula and the improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Their provocative remarks clearly prove who want dialogue and peace and who want confrontation and war.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Launch Sit-in Strike 
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Joint Action Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions for Winning Basic Labor Right, Checking Privatization and Intensifying Communality in Public Sector in south Korea entered into a sit-in strike in Youido, Seoul on June 3 in demand of the guarantee for the rights of workers.
					 At the press conference held prior to the sit-in strike, the organization accused the "government" authorities of not responding to the declaration of the Government Employees Union on forming trade unions. The organization decried the encroachment upon the basic rights of the Teachers Union and pressure put for the revision of rules.
					
					 The authorities have closed hospitals for the sake of profits and trampled down the health right of the people, it charged.
					
					 The privatization of gas, railway and electricity sectors has widened the gap between the rich and the poor, imposing pain on the common people, the organization said, questioning if it is the "era of people's happiness" trumpeted by the present regime.
					
					 The situation again brought home the truth that actions are the only way out, it said, declaring that the workers of the Confederation of Trade Unions in the public sector would stage sit-in strikes outside the building of the "National Assembly" (NA) and conduct candlelight rallies and information activities till July 2.
					
					 Then a press release was read out.
					
					 It demanded the NA and the regime recognize the right of the workers in the public sector to form organizations and have negotiations on them, and adopt a law on it.
					
					 It urged the authorities to stop at once the privatization moves and immediately opt for settling the issue of part-time jobs.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Policy for Confrontation with DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Policy for Confrontation with DPRK under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea released a statement on June 3 denouncing the puppet authorities for their policy for confrontation with the DPRK.
					 The south-north relations have plunged into a serious deadlock, the statement said.
					
					 The danger of war on the Korean Peninsula can never be removed if these relations are left intact, it noted.
					
					 The north recently proposed holding the joint national events marking the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration but the south Korean regime refused it, the statement charged.
					
					 The south Korean regime has become intent on the north-targeted war drills, pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, it held.
					
					 It urged the present regime of south Korea to stop at once its policy for confrontation with the north and seek improving the south-north relations.
					
					 It also demanded the regime acknowledge and respect all the agreements and promises made between the north and the south including the July 4 joint statement and the June 15 joint declaration and cancel the "May 24 step".

articles.title: End to Korea's Division Called for
articles.content:
End to Korea's Division Called for
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, a newspaper of Koreans in Japan, on June 1 carried an article calling for putting an end to the division of the Korean Peninsula.
					 The article denounced the U.S. for occupying south Korea after the liberation of Korea on August 15, 1945, blocking the independent reunification of the Korean nation and escalating the confrontation with the DPRK. The unabated U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises are symbolic of this, it added.
					
					 The U.S. was behind the pro-Japanese quislings in south Korea who rose to power, being disguised as pro-U.S. elements, it noted.
					
					 Neither peace nor genuine democracy can be achieved in south Korea as long as these traitors are allowed to stay in power, the article held.
					
					 In order to put an end to the division of the Korean Peninsula, it is necessary to sign a peace treaty, the article concluded.

articles.title: Korean People Will Keep to Road of Socialism: Finnish Figure
articles.content:
Korean People Will Keep to Road of Socialism: Finnish Figure
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Korean people will invariably advance along the road of socialism chosen by them.
					 Juha Kieksy, chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said this in an article titled "U.S. is to blame for the tension on the Korean Peninsula" contributed to Tyokansan Sanomat, organ of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, on May 31.
					
					 The DPRK has taken tougher counteractions against the evermore pronounced moves of the U.S. to make military provocations and stage a racket for pressure this year, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. and its satellite forces are focusing all efforts on their racket to impose sanctions on and stifle the DPRK, an independent country, with an aim at stamping out the latter.
					
					 The U.S. has kicked off the smear human rights campaign against the DPRK by instigating the south Korean authorities while resorting to the military threat to the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. military threats and sanctions will never deter the DPRK from advancing along the road of independence.
					
					 It is very just that the DPRK has taken a measure of bolstering its military capacity in every way and dynamically pushed forward economic construction to stand firm against all sorts of rackets of the U.S. to stifle it.
					
					 The DPRK, which loves peace and aspires after independence, will not yield to the imperialists' pressure nor give up socialism, though it hopes for socialist construction in a peaceful environment.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Mexico
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Mexico
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A Mexican preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War was inaugurated with due ceremony in Mexico City on May 29.
					 Present there were personages of political parties, organizations, Juche idea study groups and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people, including the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, and masses.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and lecture on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the war.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Uruguayan Paper
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Uruguayan Paper
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The June 1st issue of the Uruguayan paper La Juventud carried an article titled "The DPRK, an echo of June 15" with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il meeting Kim Dae Jung, former president of south Korea, on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The north-south summit was held in Pyongyang 13 years ago, the first of its kind in the history of Korea's division, and the historic June 15 joint declaration was adopted there, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 No sooner had the declaration been made public than it aroused strong support and positive response of not only all Koreans but the world community.
					
					 Dialogues and negotiations were held between the north and the south in various fields including politics, economy, culture and military resulting in good fruits geared to reconciliation, unity, cooperation and exchange.
					
					 The October 4 declaration, a practical programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, was adopted in 2007, which opened up a brighter prospect for Korean nation's movement for reunification.
					
					 However, the June 15 era of reunification faced serious challenge after the Lee Myung Bak's regime emerged in south Korea.
					
					 Acute inter-Korean relations have plunged into a bigger deadlock due to the present chief executive of south Korea.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that the north and the south of Korea can advance toward reunification if they support and implement the June 15 joint declaration but will face only confrontation and war if any side negates it.

articles.title: Crimean Association for Study of Juche Idea Inaugurated in Ukraine
articles.content:
Crimean Association for Study of Juche Idea Inaugurated in Ukraine
						
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea was inaugurated with due ceremony on May 10 as a branch organization of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The newly elected chairman said at the ceremony:
					
					 We will deeply grasp the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and dynamically conduct the activities for studying and disseminating the Juche idea.
					
					 We will also boost solidarity with the Korean people, who are struggling against U.S. imperialism under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, and actively support the peaceful reunification of Korea based on the Three Charters for National Reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige el Vivero de Hongos de Posong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige el Vivero de Hongos de Posong
						
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Vivero de Hongos de Posong, nuevamente construido.
					Recorriendo varios puntos del vivero, el Mariscal hizo conocimiento detallado de la produccion de bacterias, procesos de preparativo de substratos y de cultivo, etc.
					
					Diciendo que lo mas importante en el cultivo de hongos es la produccion de bacterias, pregunto de que manera las cultiva la fabrica.
					
					Recorrio el proceso del preparativo de substratos que prepara y procesa las sustancias primas necesarias a la produccion conforme a las caracteristicas de generos de seta.
					
					Viendo las instalaciones que trituran arboles y raspas de maiz que son las materias primas de produccion de substrato y el esterilizador que elimina las bacterias en las sustancias primas, subrayo la importancia de esterilizacion en la produccion de substratos.
					
					Haciendo recorrido por el proceso en que cultivan las cepas madres y las inocula en el substrato, senalo que si estan preparados las cepas madres y los substratos, pueden cultivar hongos en cualquier lugar.
					
					Luego, en varios lugares de cultivo, el Mariscal se cercioro del modo de cultivo de hongos.
					
					En el lugar hermetico de cultivo, dijo que segun generos, las setas exigen diferente temperatura y humedad y agrego que debe seleccionar el genero de hongos que es adecuado al clima y las caracteristicas de nuestro pais y tiene la alta productividad.
					
					Destaco que hay que cultivar los hongos de alta productividad inclusive agarico que crece bien bajo la temperatura de 20oC y puede cosechar mas de 100 toneladas por una hectarea.
					
					Al pasar por el lugar de cultivo de capa de vinyl, apunto que es mejor cultivar las verduras en el verano.
					
					Y se refirio a que deben construir por doquier las bases como esta que produce en gran cantidad los hongos de manera industrial para contribuir a la vida alimentaria de los militares y civiles.
					
					Indico que deben producir en gran cantidad las bacterias para enviarlas a las bases productoras de hongos a ser construidas y elaborar la guia tecnologica para el cultivo de hongos de manera industrial a fin de divulgarla en las unidades.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que bien conscientes de la voluntad del partido, todos los empleados del Vivero de Hongos de Posong deberan cumplir con su deber y enviar gran cantidad de hongos a los militares y otros habitantes.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion los primeros subjefes de departamento del Comite Central del PTC Kim Kyong Ok y Choe Hwi y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC Pak Thae Song y Hwang Pyong So.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre Club de Equitacion de Mirim en construccion
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre Club de Equitacion de Mirim en construccion
						
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno el estado de construccion del Club de Equitacion de Mirim por los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					El estimulo a los constructores militares que ponen de pleno manifiesto el temperamento combativo del ejercito revolucionario en esta obra en acato a la orden del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un.
					
					Escuchando las explicaciones sobre el mapa de disposicion general del club y el otro de vista de pajaro, se entero en detalles del estado de la obra y suministro de materiales.
					
					En la reunion consultiva convocada en el terreno, se abordo la importancia de terminar lo mas pronto posible la obra de armadura conforme a las condiciones estacionales y se tomaron las medidas para suministrar materiales y petroleo necesarios segun el programa de la obra y aumentar al maximo la produccion en las unidades de produccion de materiales.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier visito la Granja Cooperativa de Migok de la ciudad de Sariwon, prototipo de la epoca del Songun.
					
					Luego de cerciorarse en varios puntos sobre el estado de faenas agricolas, convoco una reunion consultiva, en la cual se destacaron las medidas para desarrollar las actividades de produccion agricola y de administracion, al observar los principios de despertar al maximo el entusiasmo de los granjeros.

articles.title: Portavoz de CRPP publica declaracion especial
articles.content:
Portavoz de CRPP publica declaracion especial 
						
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) publico el dia 6 la siguiente declaracion especial:
					Ya han transcurrido 13 anos desde cuando fue publicada la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Todos los connacionales no olvidan la epoca del 15 de junio en que bullia en todo el pais el clima de la reunificacion de la patria y desean de todo corazon que se mejoren cuanto antes las relaciones intercoreanas y se abra una nueva fase de reunificacion.
					
					Para la nacion coreana, la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio sirve de un evento especial digno de registrarse, que acabo con la historia de la division y enfrentamiento impuestos por las fuerzas extranjeras y abrio una nueva epoca de la reunificacion independiente.
					
					Los hechos sorprendentes ocurridos con el 15 de junio demostraron que cuando nuestra nacion toma las manos y junta las fuerzas,  no tiene nada que hacer sino puede lograr la coprosperidad de la nacion y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					Sin embargo, debido a los graves desafios de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion internas y externas, la epoca del 15 de junio fue pisoteada lamentablemente y hasta su ultima herencia esta a punto de exterminarse.
					
					Los empresarios surcoreanos reclaman por la normalizacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong y la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang, y los familiares separados en el Norte y el Sur de Corea esperan  angustiosamente el encuentro con sus  consanguineos, ultimo anhelo de toda su vida.
					
					Como los miembros de la nacion pueden dar espaldas a este estado tragico de hoy?
					
					Hasta la fecha, hemos hecho todos los esfuerzos posibles por mejorar las relaciones N-S en estado catastrofico, reanudar el turismo al Monte Kumgang, normalizar la ZIK y solucionar el problema humanitario.
					
					Pero, nuestra sinceridad y magnanimidad fueron negadas e insultadas totalmente por las sofisterias absurdas como la falta de "sinceridad", un acto para "sembrar discordia entre los habitantes surcoreanos" y "evasion de las conversaciones entre las autoridades intercoreanas".
					
					No actuamos ni una vez para sembrar la "discordia entre los habitantes surcoreanos" como dicen las autoridades surcoreanas ni las tratamos estupidamente.
					
					Precisamente ellas mismas tratan politicamente el dialogo Norte-Sur abusandolo de objetivo de la confrontacion con el Norte de Corea.
					
					A pesar de esto, no pensamos en pasar el tiempo con palabras hueras en distinguir lo justo y lo injusto.
					
					Si ambas partes coreanas obstinan en sus insistencias, no se podra encontrar la clave de solucion de los problemas pendientes N-S y solo se agrandaran la desesperacion de todas las clases y capas inclusive los empresarios surcoreanos y el desaliento de toda la nacion.
					
					Partiendo de la situacion dada, la aspiracion y la demanda de todos los connacionales y tomando en consideracion la solicitud ardiente de los empresarios surcoreanos y distintos sectores, el Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) declara por encargo la siguiente posicion importante:
					
					1. Proponemos sostener las conversaciones entre las autoridades del Norte y el Sur de Corea por la normalizacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong y la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang con motivo del 15 de junio.
					
					Si es necesario, sera posible discutir en las conversaciones tambien el problema humanitario incluyendo el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados.
					
					Seran fijados segun la conveniencia de la parte surena el lugar y el tiempo de las conversaciones.
					
					2.  Proponemos realizar con urgencia la visita de los empresarios surcoreanos a la ZIK y la zona especial de turismo internacional al monte Kumgang y el contacto concerniente de expertos y promover activamente la visita reciproca, el contacto y la cooperacion entre las entidades civiles del Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Ya hemos permitido la visita de los empresarios surcoreanos de la ZIK y permitiremos tambien la visita a la zona nortena de los surcoreanos relacionados con el negocio en el monte Kumgang.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, abrimos de par en par la puerta de la visita reciproca, el contacto y la cooperacion  de las entidades civiles surcoreanas.
					
					3. Proponemos realizar el acto conjunto nacional por el 13o aniversario de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y conmemorar en comun con la participacion de las autoridades de ambas partes el 41o aniversario de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 4 de Julio.
					
					Si las entidades civiles de ambas partes coreanas conmemoran en comun los dias de la publicacion de las declaraciones arriba mencionadas con la participacion de las autoridades, sera grande la significacion, lo cual contribuira al mejoramiento de las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					4. Si las autoridades surcoreanas responden a nuestra propuesta de realizar las conversaciones de las autoridades del Norte y el Sur de Corea, la visita de los empresarios surcoreanos a la ZIK y al monte Kumgang, las actividades conjuntas de ambas partes coreanas, etc. y resolver sin dificultad los problemas pendientes intercoreanos, tomaremos de inmediato todas las medidas referentes a la comunicacion y el enlace incluyendo la reanudacion de la via de enlace de la cruz roja en Phanmunjom.
					
					Es invariable la posicion de la RPDC de fomentar la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion y lograr la reunificacion, la paz y la prosperidad.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas desean de veras el establecimiento de la fe y la mejora de las relaciones N-S, no deben perder esta oportunidad, sino abandonar las presunciones y sospechas innecesarias y responder activamente a la magnanima decision y la sincera propuesta de la RPDC.

articles.title: Efectuado VII Congreso de la ONC
articles.content:
Efectuado VII Congreso de la ONC
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar con solemnidad el dia 6 en la capitalina Casa Cultural 25 de Abril el VII Congreso de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					El conclave tiene suma importancia para fortalecer mas la ONC, desarrollada incesantemente bajo la direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, como organizacion revolucionaria infantil del Songun del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					El Presidente dio inicio al autoctono movimiento infantil al constituir la Union de Ninos Saenal, primera organizacion revolucionaria infantil en Corea, y agrupo a muchos ninos bajo la bandera del Cuerpo Infantil Antijapones para formarlos como revolucionarios infantiles de acero.
					
					Tras fundar la ONC despues de la liberacion de la patria, el Presidente ilumino radiantemente el camino a seguir por el movimiento infantil de Corea en cada periodo y etapa de la revolucion y dirigio dinamicamente a los miembros de la ONC para que sucedan con exito la causa revolucionaria del Juche, iniciada en el monte Paektu.
					
					En el ultimo periodo de su vida, remitio un mensaje de felicitacion a los participantes en el V Congreso de la ONC y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					El Dirigente presento como asunto mas importante del partido y el Estado la labor para criar a los sucesores de la revolucion e hizo que la ONC tomara por principio formar a sus miembros como vanguardia infantil fiel al Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					El ano pasado, el Mariscal organizo solemnes actividades conmemorativas del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la ONC, tomo la fotografia de recuerdo y pronuncio el significativo discurso de felicitacion en el acto nacional de la ONC.
					
					Al visitar el Campamento de Ninos para el Alpinismo en el monte Myohyang de la ciudad de Pyongyang y el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon, hizo brindar a las nuevas generaciones la mejor felicidad en el mundo.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los delegados ejemplares de la ONC seleccionados en las entidades de la ONC en distintas localidades del pais, los funcionarios directivos de los ninos escolares y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ademas participaron en calidad de observador los hijos de los militares de los puestos de primera linea del frente inclusive las islas Jangjae, Mu y Wol y otros ninos escolares de esta capital.
					
					Salio a la tribuna del congreso el Mariscal, afectuoso padre de los ninos escolares de Corea.
					
					Le puso la panoleta roja un miembro de la ONC.
					
					El Mariscal felicito a los delegados de la ONC que le daban ardientes aclamaciones y respondio cordialmente a todos los participantes.
					
					Aparecieron en la presidencia el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el jefe del departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Yong Su, el presidente del Comite de Educacion, Kim Sung Du, los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y otros concernientes y los miembros de la ONC ejemplares en el estudio y la vida organizativa.
					
					Con el trompeteo de inicio del congreso se izo la bandera de la ONC.
					
					En la ocasion fueron abordados los puntos de la agenda "1. Para preparar con firmeza a los integrantes como verdaderos revolucionarios y vanguardistas infantiles de la epoca del Songun que sigan solo al estimado Mariscal Kim Jong Un" y "2. Sobre la enmienda de los estatutos de la ONC".
					
					En su informe sobre el primer punto de la agenda, Jon Yong Nam, presidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, senalo que en la orgullosa trayectoria de la ONC estan impregnados los cuidados generosos del Presidente y el Dirigente quienes prepararon la firme raiz del autoctono movimiento infantil y dirigieron paso a paso la labor de la ONC conforme a la demanda de la revolucion en desarrollo.
					
					Bajo la sabia orientacion y la atencion minuciosa del Generalisimo Kim Jong Il y el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, se han logrado notables exitos en la labor de la ONC despues del 6o congreso de esta organizacion infantil, puntualizo.
					
					Asevero que todos los integrantes de la ONC deben prepararse firmemente como fidedignos continuadores de la revolucion del Songun infinitamente fieles al Mariscal conservando el orgullo de ser miembros de la ONC de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y cumpliendo el juramento tomado ante la bandera de la ONC.
					
					En el conclave los oradores expusieron sus honores y alegrias de haber participado en el VII Congreso de la ONC efectuado bajo la presencia del Mariscal, enumeraron sus orgullos por haber ganado siempre 5 puntos mejores en poseer por igual ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud en el regazo de los grandes hombres sin pares y expresaron la decision de continuar hasta el fin la marcha del Paektu siguiendo al partido.
					
					Hubo intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores expresaron sus glorias y alegrias por haber participado en el citado conclave bajo la presencia del Mariscal y sus orgullos de que habian poseido por igual ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud en el regazo de los Generalisimos y su inconmovible decision de continuar la marcha del Paektu siguiendo al partido.
					
					El Mariscal dio cordiales aplausos a las intervenciones de los delegados.
					
					Quedo aprobada en la cita la resolucion sobre el primer punto de la agenda.
					
					A continuacion, fue discutido y aprobado el segundo punto de la agenda "Sobre la enmienda de los estatutos de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea".
